column4: hi, a quick quest. . when i backed up my /var/cache/apt/archives , so I can install it on an ubuntu offline machine, what command i have to input to install the programms and libraries(deb files) correctly? (dpkg -i *.deb?)
long time ago i used dpkg -i *deb and all the dependencies breaked me my apt system
has anyone a clue?
and whats with the dependencies from the programms, they have to installed first
standby i know the perfect app for you
keryx?
i dont think so, 1sec
APTonCD
wow, thanks :D i want look for it
i havent used it so i dont know exactly how it works but based on the screenshot it looks fairly straight-forward
only one way to find out :)
yes they can
is there even a bluray app for ubuntu lol
so what's the problem lol
are you trying to make a custom ubuntu installation or just some apps?
i just downloaded APTonCD. just install whatever you want to burn, then when you click "create" it will appear on the list
it's an app install cd for ubuntu
now we're going back a few questions :P are you trying to install ubuntu or just apps?
okay then, 1sec
what you need then is Ubuntu Customization Kit
then just do a standard install and then use a APTonCD .... cd
